question: 東京都
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>Tokyo</kanji> <kanji>Metropolis</kanji> is, of course, the <vocabulary>Tokyo Metropolis</vocabulary>. Technically this is one of Japan's prefectures, but it's called a "Metropolis" instead. It's the capital and the largest city in all of Japan!
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is just <ja>東京</ja> and <ja>都</ja> (<ja>と</ja>). Really it's all just the reading you learned with the kanji, too, so you can think of it that way as well.
